turns.content: I work in marketing as the head of a communications team for GVI. I am also the main person who works on our creative brand strategy. Part of my role is being responsible for our social media marketing strategy. My CEO expects rapid growth via social media. I need to present a new social media strategy for 2023. Give me some suggestions of outstanding strategists whose work I could study. Prioritise the most current and influential names.

Sure, here are some outstanding strategists whose work you could study to help inform your social media strategy:

1. Gary Vaynerchuk - Gary Vaynerchuk, also known as GaryVee, is a highly influential digital marketing expert and founder of VaynerMedia. He is known for his emphasis on creating engaging content that speaks directly to your target audience.
2. Neil Patel - Neil Patel is a digital marketing influencer and founder of Neil Patel Digital. He is recognized for his extensive knowledge of SEO, content marketing, and social media marketing.
3. Jay Baer - Jay Baer is a digital marketing consultant and founder of Convince & Convert. He has been named the #1 content marketer in the world by Content Marketing Institute and is known for his expertise in creating customer-centric social media strategies.
4. Mari Smith - Mari Smith is a social media thought leader and author of "The New Relationship Marketing". She is an expert in Facebook marketing and has been named as one of Forbes' Top Social Media Power Influencers.
5. Matt Navarra - Matt Navarra is a social media consultant and industry commentator. He is highly influential on Twitter and provides valuable insights into the latest social media trends and best practices.
6. Andrew Hutchinson - Andrew Hutchinson is a social media and content marketing expert and the author of "The Ultimate Guide to Social Media for Business Owners, Professionals, and Entrepreneurs". He provides valuable insights on the latest social media trends and best practices.
7. Amy Porterfield - Amy Porterfield is an online marketing strategist and the host of the "Online Marketing Made Easy" podcast. She specializes in helping small business owners and entrepreneurs create successful social media marketing campaigns.

I hope this helps! Good luck with your new social media strategy for 2023.
What about adding Julian Cole to this list?

Absolutely! Julian Cole is a digital strategist and thought leader in the advertising and marketing industry. He is the co-founder of Communications Strategy Group, and has previously worked at some of the biggest advertising agencies in the world, including BBDO, JWT, and BBH.

Julian Cole is particularly known for his expertise in social media and content strategy, and has published several articles and guides on these topics. He is also the creator of the Planning Dirty Academy, a platform that offers courses and resources for digital strategists.

Overall, Julian Cole is a great addition to the list of outstanding strategists whose work you could study to inform your social media strategy.

Give me the list again but put the names in priority order (so I know whom you suggest as the absolute best people to draw one). Prioritise the people whose approaches and case studies you can draw from because I am going to ask you to write my social strategy based on their work later.

Sure, here is the list of outstanding strategists for you, prioritized based on their relevance and influence in social media marketing:

1. Gary Vaynerchuk
2. Neil Patel
3. Jay Baer
4. Mari Smith
5. Julian Cole
6. Matt Navarra
7. Andrew Hutchinson
8. Amy Porterfield

I recommend starting with Gary Vaynerchuk, Neil Patel, and Jay Baer as they are considered some of the most influential and experienced digital marketing experts in the industry. They have a wealth of experience and have produced a variety of resources, such as books, articles, podcasts, and videos, that can provide insights and strategies for developing a successful social media strategy.

Mari Smith and Julian Cole are also highly regarded as social media experts and can provide valuable insights and examples for developing a social media strategy. Matt Navarra, Andrew Hutchinson, and Amy Porterfield are also important names to consider, especially if you're looking for more specific insights or case studies related to your particular industry or niche.

Remember, though, that there is no one-size-fits-all approach to social media marketing. Your social media strategy should be unique to your brand and target audience. Use these experts as a starting point to inform and inspire your strategy, but always keep your unique goals and challenges in mind.

1. What are your overall business goals for the next year, and how do you see social media playing a role in achieving those goals?

2. What are your target audience demographics and characteristics, and what social media channels do they use the most? Are there any specific challenges or pain points that your audience is facing, and how can your social media strategy help address them?
3. What are your competitors doing on social media, and how can you differentiate your brand from theirs? Are there any gaps or opportunities that your competitors have not yet addressed on social media?
4. What types of content do you plan to create and share on social media, and how do you plan to measure the success of your content? Will you be using a mix of visual and written content, such as photos, videos, blog posts, infographics, or social media ads?
5. What is your social media budget, and how will you allocate it across different social media channels and activities? Will you be using any social media management or analytics tools to help track and optimize your performance?
6. What is your posting frequency and schedule, and how will you engage with your audience on social media? Will you be using any influencer partnerships or user-generated content campaigns to help increase your reach and engagement?

Once I have this information, I can begin to develop a tailored social media strategy that is specific to your brand and target audience. This may include setting clear goals and objectives, creating a content calendar and production plan, identifying the best social media channels to use and the types of content that work best on each channel, and implementing a measurement and optimization plan to track and adjust your performance over time.
You're welcome! If you have any more questions or need any further assistance, feel free to ask. Good luck with your social media strategy!
